availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marcellus Mundy (Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Owen County, Kentucky, native. Son of Harrison Mundy and Elvira Foster Mundy. Married to Margaret Offutt Mundy. Father of St. Mare Mundy. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Relocated to Philadelphia. Studied law under Professor Hoffman and T. T. Wharton. Attorney in Philadelphia. Colonel of the Garibaldi Legion of Philadelphia. Resigned his commission. Relocated to Kentucky. Colonel of the 23rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from January 1862 to October 1, 1862. Detached as commander of the post of Louisville in the District of Western Kentucky of the Department of the Ohio from October 1862 to December 1863. Resigned on December 31, 1863. Attorney in Louisville.

ab.bibl: Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0361. Roger D. Hunt, Colonels in Blueâ€”Indiana, Kentucky and Tennessee: A Civil War Biographical Dictionary (Jefferson, N.C.: McFarland, 2014), 180. Josiah Stoddard Johnston, ed., Memorial History of Louisville from its First Settlement to the Year 1896 vol.1 (Chicago: American Biographical Publishing Co., 1896), 463.
